TEXT.P: Imagine that an industrial solvent has been discovered as a contaminant in groundwater in a major metropolitan area.
A dose-response study is conducted to evaluate the toxicity of the contaminant. Groups of laboratory mice are exposed to the contaminant in the concentrations listed in the table.
The test animals are monitored for toxic effects. The table at left shows the percentage of test animals exhibiting toxic effects for each dose level.

Plot the data by dragging the data points (green dots) to the correct location on the graph. If you are having trouble, try finding the location along the X-axis first, then dragging the point upward until it is at the correct height along the Y-axis.
